intro: Psychotria fissicorne, commonly known as the "Clove Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in dense understory habitats of tropical rainforests. Psychotria fissicorne is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecological interactions of its native ecosystems.
